plants.name: succulent
notes: Soak the soil until water runs out of the drainage holes.
Let the soil dry between waterings.

plants.name: rubber plant
notes: Plant should not be in the direct path of an air conditioner.
Let the soil dry completely between waterings.

plants.name: peace lily
notes: Avoid direct sunlight.
Soil must be kept moist but not soggy.

plants.name: parlor palm
notes: Avoid direct sunlight.
Wash in the sink every few weeks to keep the foliage clean and pest free.

plants.name: fiddle leaf fig
notes: Cut back a few leaves every once in awhile to encourage growth.
Let the soil dry between waterings.

plants.name: peperomia
notes: Cut back a few leaves every once in awhile to encourage growth.
Let the soil dry between waterings.

plants.name: spider plant
notes: Needs lots of bright indirect light
Let the soil dry between waterings.

plants.name: calathea
notes: Prefers warmer and humid climates.
Avoid direct sunlight.

plants.name: snake plant
notes: Let the soil dry completely between waterings.
Prefers warmer temperatures.

plants.name: citrus tree
notes: Clean to avoid dust on leaves.
Let the soil dry between waterings.

plants.name: aloe
notes: Use a mix of soil, perlite, lava rock, chunks of bark.
Let the soil dry completely between waterings.

plants.name: orchid
notes: Airflow should be very light, but present.
Let the soil dry completely between waterings.

plants.name: philodendron
notes: Avoid direct sunlight.
Give vining types room to roam.

plants.name: african violet
notes: Needs lots of bright indirect light
Water with lukewarm water.

plants.name: ficus
notes: Needs lots of bright indirect light
When the soil is lightly damp, water.
